The plant produces small, elongated capsules for spore dispersal, which are often covered with a peristome. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rocky surfaces. Craspedoneuron pallidum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
